config_description: Compression to apply to the commit log. If omitted, the commit log will be written uncompressed.  LZ4, Snappy, and Deflate compressors are supported.
developer_understanding_on_working: The 'commitlog_compression' configuration is used to specify the compression algorithm to apply to the commit log. The code snippet provided shows that the configuration value is retrieved using DatabaseDescriptor.getCommitLogCompression() and is used to create a Configuration object.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The triggering frequency of the 'commitlog_compression' configuration in the system depends on when the CommitLog class is instantiated. Typically, this configuration is set when the CommitLog class is initialized.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the 'commitlog_compression' configuration option on the system is that it affects the size of the commit log files. By choosing a compression algorithm such as LZ4, Snappy, or Deflate, the size of the commit log files can be reduced, potentially saving disk space and improving write performance.
